item.title: [JDK-8348625] [21u, 17u] Revert JDK-8185862 to restore old java.awt.headless behavior on Windows
item.description:
JDK-8185862 changed the detection of headless mode on Windows by enumerating displays and turning on headless mode when only virtual devices exist. This causes problems with several use cases, mostly for automatic testing, e.g. JDK-8336862, JDK-8340992, JDK-8341294.

While the new detection mode seems correct from its idea, we should revert the change for the current LTS update releases and try to focus on fixing issues with explicitly using -Djava.awt.headless=true in the head release.
item.summary: [21u, 17u] Revert JDK-8185862 to restore old java.awt.headless behavior on Windows

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
[~afarley] there is no intend to remove the new behavior from head but rather to fix it. Currently [~dbriemann] is working on fixing this, e.g. in JDK-8341294. However, he was struggling to reproduce the problem. On another issue, the idea was to somehow allowing the old behavior when a user explicitly sets -Djava.awt.headless=false, see JDK-8336862. Also for that one, we'd need some scenario/reproducer on which base such a change could be developed.

Apart from that, JDK24u is closed for changes now, so the fix request will not be approved any more. I also don't see a PR for 24u.

Also, can this be removed from jdk25 and jdk-head? Seems odd that we'd have to repeatedly undo this change to unbreak workflows.

I'm not opposed to re-introducing this into the jdk once solutions have been found for this matter.

Fix request (24u):
Same reasoning as for 21u and jdk17u.
"Undo" Commit: https://github.com/adamfarley/jdk/commit/fc79d49ca7031134b626583910f33f5e3cf67e68
"Security Action Removal" Commit: https://github.com/adamfarley/jdk/commit/6e1575f22914369acd3f20189f84452cc023b132
Commits tested here: https://ci.adoptium.net/job/build-scripts/job/jobs/job/jdk24u/job/jdk24u-windows-x64-temurin/10/
Note: Build stage passed fine. Later stage failed for unrelated reasons.

Fix request (17u):
Same reasoning as for 21u. This reverts a backport which mainly addressed an issue unveiled by tests in a "headless" Windows environment. However, the change that was introduced by the fix broke existing CI integrations of users, and it will help quite a few folks when the old behavior gets restored.
Backport tested in SAP nightlies, no regressions spotted.

A pull request was submitted for review.
Branch: master
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk17u-dev/pull/3270
Date: 2025-02-06 20:10:03 +0000

Changeset: e1967d51
Branch: master
Author: Christoph Langer <clanger@openjdk.org>
Date: 2025-01-31 10:23:00 +0000
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk21u/commit/e1967d5124309de5276ab88d1bcf4d24f2620dab

Changeset: e1967d51
Branch: master
Author: Christoph Langer <clanger@openjdk.org>
Date: 2025-01-31 10:23:00 +0000
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk21u-dev/commit/e1967d5124309de5276ab88d1bcf4d24f2620dab
OK, thanks.

No, I think for 21 and 17 there should not be a redo. And in the head releases I'll have a look at fixing the RDP issue, I'm optimistic for that. Hopefully, with that we can enable "-Djava.awt.headless=true" as a viable alternative for customers that go forward with their Java version and need that kind of headful testing in a headless environment.

Yes. Lets unbreak some JDK 21/17 users.

[~clanger] Is there a "REDO" like bug for this? I suppose there will be an attempt again to make it work in certain headless environments by specifying a property or some such. Would be good to be able to watch such a bug. Thanks!

Fix request (21u):
This reverts a backport which mainly addressed an issue unveiled by tests in a "headless" Windows environment. However, the change that was introduced by the fix broke existing CI integrations of users, and it will help quite a few folks when the old behavior gets restored.
In this case, we know the specific versions where the problem was introduced, I updated the ‘Affects Versions’ field.
[~clanger] AFAIK, JDK-8185862 isn't in OpenJDK 11. The bug synopsis mentions 11. Is that correct?

A pull request was submitted for review.
Branch: master
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk21u-dev/pull/1359
Date: 2025-01-26 12:35:01 +0000

Backout the backport of 8337994 to 21u.

We see failures of test/jdk/jdk/jfr/jvm/TestChunkIntegrity.java with slowdebug and fastdebug builds.
The failure is well reproducible with the slowdebug build, but with faster binaries the test passes sometimes.
In our nightly CI with high load the fastdebug build fails reliably.

item.title: [JDK-8345370] Bump update version for OpenJDK: jdk-21.0.7
item.description:
Development of update 21.0.7 starts in repository jdk21u-dev on Wednesday December 4th, 2024. The first change should be to bump the version.

Release of 21.0.7 is planned for Tuesday April 15th, 2025.

For the date, see also https://wiki.openjdk.org/display/JDKUpdates/JDK%2021u or https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/
